description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2kuli","text":"Here, we introduce a low-cost, high-throughput method for diagnosis of SARS-CoV-2 infection, dubbed Pathogen- Oriented Low-Cost Assembly \u0026 Re-Sequencing (POLAR), that enhances sensitivity by aiming to amplify the entire SARS-CoV-2 genome rather than targeting particular viral loci, as in typical RT- PCR assays. To achieve this goal, we combine a SARS-CoV-2 enrichment method developed by the ARTIC Network (https://artic.network/) with short-read DNA sequencing and de novo genome assembly. For details on our computational pipeline for automated data processing, including documentation and test set, please visit our Githuh at https://github.com/aidenlab/Polar.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":468,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":631,"length":33}],"data":{}},{"key":"eibkd","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12on","text":"The last step in this version contains a supplemental video with extra context and tips, as part of the protocols.io Spotlight series, featuring conversations with protocol authors.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":4,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0BA67362872111EA8C7D0242AC110002","url":"https://github.com/aidenlab/Polar"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5BF8CD62B96011EEAD400A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/pathogen-oriented-low-cost-assembly-amp-re-sequenc-c7x8zprw?step=88"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"54ur3","text":"SARS-CoV-2 Specific Primer Set","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ch77l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2eu20","text":"The ARTIC Network designed and tested1 the primer set used in this protocol and must be custom ordered prior to experiments. Details on their primer set can be found on their Github page https://github.com/artic-network/artic-ncov2019.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":37,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":187,"length":47}],"data":[]},{"key":"5829b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5h9as","text":"Artic Network. https://artic.network/resources/ncov/ncov-amplicon-v3.pdf.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":57}],"data":[]},{"key":"b9b2u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fna7f","text":"The World Health Organization: Dos and Don’ts for Molecular Testing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1n5v","text":"(https://www.who.int/malaria/areas/diagnosis/molecular-testing-dos-donts/en/)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":1,"length":75}],"data":[]},{"key":"bpl71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qc15","text":"Molecular detection methods have the ability to produce a large volume of nucleic acid through the amplification of trace quantities found in samples. While this is beneficial for enabling sensitive detection, it also introduces the possibility of contamination through the spreading of amplicon aerosols in the laboratory environment. When conducting experiments, measures can be undertaken to avoid the contamination of reagents, laboratory equipment, and bench space, as such contamination may generate false-positive (or false-negative) results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"611rh","text":"To help reduce the likelihood of contamination, Good Laboratory Practice should be exercised at all times. Specifically, precautions should be taken regarding the following points:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d7pga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdn9f","text":"Handling reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"926sj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fe6ld","text":"Briefly centrifuge reagent tubes before opening to avoid the generation of aerosols.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"damhr","text":"Aliquot reagents to avoid multiple freeze-thaw and the contamination of master stocks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"264ue","text":"Clearly label and date all reagent and reaction tubes and maintain logs of reagent lot and batch numbers used in all experiments.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eou5k","text":"Pipette all reagents and samples using filter tips. Prior to purchase, it is advisable to confirm with the manufacturer that the filter tips fit the brand of the pipette to be used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ds41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"h6ui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"91b13","text":"Organization of workspace and equipment","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dc9g3","text":"","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fpcfb","text":"The workspace should be organized to ensure that the flow of work occurs in one direction, from clean areas (pre-PCR) to dirty areas (post-PCR). The following general precautions will help to reduce the chance of contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":214}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b6t26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"44lci","text":"Have separate designated rooms, or at minimum physically separate areas, for:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1mqb5","text":"master mix preparation,","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4uj1a","text":"nucleic acid extraction and DNA template addition","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9knjn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8h3rm","text":"In some settings, having 4 separate rooms is difficult. A possible but less desirable option is to do the master mix preparation in a containment area, e.g. a laminar flow cabinet. In the case of nested PCR amplification, the preparation of the master mix for the second round reaction should be prepared in the ‘clean’ area for master mix preparation, but the inoculation with the primary PCR product should be done in the amplification room, and if possible in a dedicated containment area (e.g. a laminar flow cabinet).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9t4ro","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5bd0e","text":"Each room/area needs a separate set of clearly labeled pipettes, filter tips, tube racks, vortexes, centrifuges (if relevant), pens, generic lab reagents, lab coats, and boxes of gloves that will remain at their respective workstations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e747n","text":"Hands must be washed and gloves and lab coats changed when moving between the designated areas. Reagents and equipment should not be moved from a dirty area to a clean area. Should an extreme case arise where a reagent or piece of equipment needs to be moved backward, it must first be decontaminated with 10% sodium hypochlorite, followed by a wipe down with sterile water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4vfbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3l0pn","text":"Ideally, staff should abide by the unidirectional workflow ethos and not go from dirty areas (post-PCR) back to clean areas (pre-PCR) on the same day. However, there may be occasions when this is unavoidable. When such occasion arises, personnel must take care to thoroughly wash hands, change gloves, use the designated lab coat and not introduce any equipment they will want to take out of the room again, such as lab books. Such control measures should be emphasized in staff training on molecular methods.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"37qmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"m33c","text":"After use, bench spaces should be cleaned with 10% sodium hypochlorite (followed by sterile water to remove residual bleach), 70% ethanol, or a validated commercially available DNA-destroying decontaminant. Ideally, ultra-violet (UV) lamps should be fitted to enable decontamination by irradiation. However, the use of UV lamps should be restricted to closed working areas, e.g. safety cabinets, in order to limit the laboratory staff’s UV exposure. Please abide by manufacturer instructions for UV lamp care, ventilation, and cleaning in order to ensure that lamps remain effective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ukl0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1bqe2","text":"If manufacturer instructions permit it, pipettes should be routinely sterilized by autoclave. If pipettes cannot be autoclaved, it should suffice to clean them with 10% sodium hypochlorite (followed by a thorough wipe down with sterile water) or with a commercial DNA-destroying decontaminant followed by UV exposure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3fc4u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4846p","text":"All equipment needs to be calibrated regularly according to the manufacturer-recommended schedule. A designated person should be in charge of ensuring that the calibration schedule is adhered to, detailed logs are maintained, and service labels are clearly displayed on equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8b2e3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"46hbt","text":"Use and cleaning advice for the designated molecular space","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":58},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":58}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ddfie","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm5ni","text":"Pre-PCR: Reagent aliquoting / mastermix preparation","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"398ff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4urom","text":"This should be the cleanest of all spaces used for the preparation of molecular experiments and should ideally be a designated laminar flow cabinet equipped with a UV light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ia5u","text":"Samples, extracted nucleic acid, and amplified PCR products must not be handled in this area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"gmc8","text":"Amplification reagents should be kept in a freezer (or refrigerator, as per manufacturer recommendations) in the same designated space, ideally next to the laminar flow cabinet or pre-PCR area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"n5ce","text":"Gloves should be changed each time upon entering the pre-PCR area or laminar flow cabinet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72r8m","text":"The pre-PCR area or laminar flow cabinet should be cleaned before and after use as follows: Wipe down all items in the cabinet, e.g. pipettes, tip boxes, vortex, centrifuge, tube racks, pens, etc. with 70% ethanol or a commercial DNA-destroying decontaminant, and allow to dry. In the case of a closed working area, e.g. a laminar flow cabinet, expose the hood to UV light for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d67cv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"79ibu","text":"Pre-PCR: Nucleic acid extraction/template addition","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6evsf","text":"","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fjki9","text":"Nucleic acid must be extracted and handled in a second designated area, using a separate set of pipettes, filter tips, tube racks, fresh gloves, lab coats, and other equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2ktss","text":"This area is also for the addition of template, controls, and trendlines to the master mix tubes or plates. To avoid contamination of the extracted nucleic acid samples that are being analyzed, it is recommended to change gloves prior to handling positive controls or standards and to use a separate set of pipettes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7h9pf","text":"PCR reagents and amplified products must not be pipetted in this area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9o5fd","text":"Samples should be stored in designated fridges or freezers in the same area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"da9a4","text":"The sample workspace should be cleaned in the same way as the master mix space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"u4hi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"da2m6","text":"Post-PCR: Amplification and handling of the amplified product","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"52d80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aubn2","text":"This designated space is for post-amplification processes and should be physically separate from the pre-PCR areas. It usually contains thermocyclers and real-time platforms, and ideally should have a laminar flow cabinet for adding the round 1 PCR product to the round 2 reaction, if nested PCR is being performed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fkc9f","text":"PCR reagents and extracted nucleic acid must not be handled in this area since the risk of contamination are high.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ne6c","text":"This area should have a separate set of gloves, lab coats, plate and tube racks, pipettes, filter tips, bins, and other equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7qs61","text":"Tubes must be centrifuged before opening.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"22dd8","text":"The sample workspace should be cleaned in the same way as the master mix space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"de8su","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0AE423ED872211EA8C7D0242AC110002","url":"https://github.com/artic-network/artic-ncov2019"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"99A0116D872211EA8C7D0242AC110002","url":"https://artic.network/resources/ncov/ncov-amplicon-v3.pdf"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0EC56FC0870711EA8C7D0242AC110002","url":"https://www.who.int/malaria/areas/diagnosis/molecular-testing-dos-donts/en"}}}}
